content:
Provided always that:
(i) You or Your Authorised Driver is not less than eighteen (18) or more than sixty-five (65) years of age at the time of injury
(ii) the passenger(s) travelling in the Insured Vehicle is not less than sixteen (16) or more than sixty-five (65) years of age at the time of injury
(iii) the death or bodily injury shall occur within three (3) calendar months of the accident independent of any other cause (except medical or surgical treatment consequent upon such injury)

If You have more than one private motor car insurance policy with Us, payment will be made under one (1) policy only.
questions: What is the age requirement for drivers under the insurance policy?
What age must passengers be to be covered under this insurance policy?
How soon after an accident must death or bodily injury occur to be covered?
Is there a limit to the number of private motor car insurance policies from which one can claim?
What happens if both the driver and passengers are injured in an accident?
Does the insurance policy cover injuries that occur due to medical treatment after an accident?
What is the maximum age limit for drivers to be eligible for insurance coverage?
Are there any age restrictions for passengers in the insured vehicle?
In the event of multiple insurance policies, how is the claim payment determined?
What is the minimum age for a driver to be covered under this insurance policy?
